officialLinks.name: General conditions of carriage for passengers and baggage

sourceDates.note: No explicit last updated noted; page viewed Jan 31, 2026. Footer shows © Finnair 2026.
No explicit last updated noted; page viewed Jan 31, 2026.
Page states: As of 1st June 2022 Finnair accepts live animals (AVI) for transport on European narrow-body aircraft routes. Page viewed Jan 31, 2026.

policyFindings: In-cabin (PETC): Allowed species include small cats, small dogs, pet rabbits, tortoises and hedgehogs (the latter three only when traveling from EU countries). Maximum combined weight (pet + carrier) is 8 kg (17.6 lb). Pet must remain in a closed carrier under the seat. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

In-cabin (PETC) booking/availability: Add during booking (Travel extras) or later via Manage booking. Usually a maximum of two customers with pets in cabin per flight; one carrier per customer. Not available in long-haul Business Class; contact customer service to add PETC if flying Finnair short-haul Business, Finnair long-haul Premium Economy, or on Jettime flights. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

In-cabin carrier types/sizes (IATA-approved): On Finnair flights soft carrier 55 x 40 x 23 cm (21.7 x 15.7 x 9.1 in); hard carrier 35 x 30 x 20 cm (14.8 x 11.9 x 7.9 in). On Norra flights soft 55 x 40 x 20 cm; hard 35 x 30 x 20 cm. Up to two pets in one carrier if total weight ≤ 8 kg. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)
Online check-in is not available when traveling with a pet. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

On flights operated by DAT: only cats, dogs and rabbits are allowed in cabin; on Jettime: only cats and dogs. Carrier size rules may differ; contact customer service. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

In the aircraft hold (AVIH): Accepted animals include bigger dogs and ferrets; total weight (pet + container) up to 75 kg on Finnair-operated flights; up to 50 kg on Norra-operated flights. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Hold container maximum sizes depend on aircraft: A330/A350 and A319/A320/A321 up to 122 x 81 x 89 cm; Embraer 190 (Norra) up to 101 x 68 x 76 cm; ATR (Norra) up to 81 x 57 x 53 cm. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Hold booking and connections: Book flights online at least 7 days before departure, then notify Finnair via chat within 24 hours. Minimum connection time with a pet in hold is 3 hours. Pets in hold do not transfer automatically at Helsinki; you must collect and re-check your pet. AVIH not possible if itinerary includes flights operated by other airlines. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Hold container rules: IATA-compliant; pet must be able to stand, lie down and turn; pets over 40 kg require a strong box. In one container, transport two adult pets of comparable size or up to three puppies from the same litter, with max 14 kg per pet (subject to country rules). (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Pets as cargo: Must ship as cargo if combined weight exceeds 75 kg (Finnair) or 50 kg (Norra); for species other than dogs, cats, pet rabbits, tortoises, hedgehogs and ferrets; when traveling from outside the EU (except dogs/cats/ferrets); to or via certain countries; or for unaccompanied animals/third-party imports. Book through a forwarding company. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Cargo network note: As of 1 June 2022 Finnair accepts live animals on European narrow-body routes; wide-body flights may be accepted on request. Finnair carries live animals only to direct Finnair destinations; shipments to Finland must arrive to Helsinki (HEL). (https://cargo.finnair.com/en/products-services/special-cargo-products/live-animals)

Fees (per carrier/container; Finnair-operated/marketed flights; pay in advance): Pet in cabin, Europe: €60 (≥7 days before departure) or €65 (≤6 days). Intercontinental (incl. Middle East): €120/$130 (≥7 days) or €130/$140 (≤6 days). (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Fees (hold): Pet in hold (≤75 kg Finnair or ≤50 kg Norra), one-way: Europe €140; Intercontinental €650/$700. Departures from India: local taxes added. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Service animals: Accepted in cabin free of charge (qualified assistance/service dogs such as guide, hearing, diabetic alert, seizure alert, mobility assistance). Also narcotic detection and search-and-rescue dogs on official missions. Notify at least 48 hours before departure via the special assistance form. (https://www.finnair.com/en/special-assistance-and-health/travelling-with-an-assistance-dog)

Psychiatric service dogs are accepted only on direct flights to/from the United States, with required U.S. DOT Service Animal forms. Emotional support animals are not accepted as service animals. (https://www.finnair.com/en/special-assistance-and-health/travelling-with-an-assistance-dog)

Documents/age: EU Pet Passport is mandatory for cats, dogs and ferrets traveling between EU countries. Check country authorities for other document, vaccination and quarantine requirements. Puppies must be at least 8 weeks old, weaned and eating independently. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Embargoes/limitations: Acceptance can be limited by aircraft type, destination weather or allergic passengers. No fixed seasonal embargo windows listed on the policy page. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Breed restrictions: No airline-wide list of prohibited dog/cat breeds published for PETC/AVIH on referenced pages. Country-specific rules may apply; Finnair requests dog breed details when arranging assistance-dog travel. (https://www.finnair.com/en/special-assistance-and-health/travelling-with-an-assistance-dog)
notes: Norra refers to Nordic Regional Airlines, which operates some Finnair flights; different weight limits and carrier dimensions apply on Norra aircraft. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)
PETC availability and AVIH acceptance are capacity-controlled; if Finnair cannot accept the pet, ticket refunds are mentioned as possible. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

If your itinerary involves other airlines, contact Finnair customer service; AVIH is not possible on itineraries containing other operating carriers, and PETC rules differ by airline. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)

Always verify destination import rules, as some countries restrict multiple animals in one container or restrict species such as rabbits, hedgehogs or tortoises. (https://www.finnair.com/en/pets-on-finnair-flights)
No operator notes were provided; nothing to resolve.

draft.PetPolicySummary: Finnair accepts small cats, dogs, pet rabbits, tortoises and hedgehogs in the cabin when the combined weight of pet and carrier is 8 kg (17.6 lb) or less; rabbits, tortoises and hedgehogs are accepted in-cabin only when traveling from EU countries. Larger pets (e.g., bigger dogs and ferrets) may travel in the aircraft hold on Finnair-operated flights up to a total of 75 kg (pet + container), or up to 50 kg on Norra-operated flights. Animals exceeding these limits, species not accepted as PETC/AVIH, certain routings, and unaccompanied shipments must travel as cargo via a forwarding company. Space is limited and advance request is required; online check-in is not available for pet bookings. Qualified assistance/service dogs travel in the cabin free of charge; psychiatric service dogs are accepted only on nonstop flights to/from the USA; emotional support animals are not accepted. Follow all destination veterinary/document rules (e.g., EU Pet Passport for cats, dogs and ferrets within the EU); minimum age is 8 weeks and puppies must be weaned. Fees apply and vary by route.
draft.ImprovedPetPolicySummary:
Finnair Pet Policy (Summary)

  • In cabin (PETC): Small cats, dogs, pet rabbits, tortoises and hedgehogs allowed when pet + carrier ≤ 8 kg (17.6 lb). Note: rabbits, tortoises and hedgehogs are accepted in-cabin only when traveling from EU countries.
  • Carrier sizes (Finnair-operated): Soft 55 x 40 x 23 cm; Hard 35 x 30 x 20 cm. Norra-operated: Soft 55 x 40 x 20 cm; Hard 35 x 30 x 20 cm.
  • Cabin availability: Capacity-controlled (typically max two customers with pets per flight). One carrier per customer; up to two pets may share one carrier if total ≤ 8 kg. Not available in long-haul Business Class. Online check-in is not available when traveling with a pet.
  • In hold (AVIH): Bigger dogs and ferrets accepted up to 75 kg total on Finnair flights (50 kg on Norra). Crate must be IATA-compliant. Typical maximum crate dimensions (cm): A330/A350 and A319/A320/A321: 122 x 81 x 89; Embraer 190 (Norra): 101 x 68 x 76; ATR (Norra): 81 x 57 x 53. Minimum connection time with AVIH is 3 hours; pets do not transfer automatically at HEL—you must collect and re-check. AVIH not possible if the itinerary includes other operating carriers.
  • Pets as cargo: Required when exceeding AVIH limits, for species not accepted as PETC/AVIH, some routings/countries, or for unaccompanied/third-party shipments. Book via a forwarding company.
  • Service animals: Qualified assistance/service dogs travel in cabin free of charge. Psychiatric service dogs accepted only on nonstop flights to/from the USA with required DOT forms. Emotional support animals are not accepted.
  • Documents/age: Follow destination rules. EU Pet Passport is required for cats, dogs and ferrets traveling within the EU. Puppies must be at least 8 weeks old and weaned.
  • Fees (Finnair-marketed/operated, per carrier/container): PETC Europe €60 (≥7 days) / €65 (≤6 days); Intercontinental (incl. Middle East) €120/$130 (≥7 days) / €130/$140 (≤6 days). AVIH ≤75 kg (Finnair) or ≤50 kg (Norra): Europe €140; Intercontinental €650/$700. Cargo priced via Finnair Cargo/forwarder.
  • Important: Acceptance depends on aircraft type, routing and weather; always verify country-specific import rules before travel.
draft.inCompartmentDetails: In-cabin species: cats, small dogs, pet rabbits, tortoises and hedgehogs. Pet rabbits, tortoises and hedgehogs are accepted in the cabin only when traveling from EU countries. Max combined weight (pet + carrier) 8 kg; one carrier per customer; up to two pets may share one carrier if total ≤ 8 kg.
draft.inCargoDetails: Other animals mentioned (cargo): Living animals, Mammals, Fish, Crustacean Amphibians
draft.carrierCompartmentDetails:
In-Cabin Carrier Details

Small pets such as cats, small dogs, pet rabbits, tortoises, and hedgehogs* can travel in the cabin if the combined weight of pet and carrier does not exceed 8 kg (17.6 lb).

  • The carrier must fit under the seat in front of you and remain closed throughout the flight.
  • Pets are not allowed in Business Class on long-haul flights due to limited space under seats.
  • Only one pet carrier per customer is permitted.
  • Typically, two customers with pets are accepted per flight, but this may vary based on aircraft type, destination weather, or passenger allergies.

Your pet must stay in a securely closed carrier from the departure gate until arrival for safety and comfort.

  • The pet should be able to stand and lie down comfortably inside the carrier.
  • If the carrier is too small, the pet may be denied boarding during check-in.
  • Soft carriers are recommended for flexibility and ease of fitting under the seat.
  • Up to two pets can share one carrier if the total weight does not exceed 8 kg (17.6 lb).

Maximum pet carrier sizes:

  • Flights operated by Finnair:
    • Soft carriers: 55 x 40 x 23 cm (21.7 x 15.7 x 9.1 in)
    • Hard carriers: 35 x 30 x 20 cm (14.8 x 11.9 x 7.9 in)
  • Flights operated by Norra:
    • Soft carriers: 55 x 40 x 20 cm (21.7 x 15.7 x 7.9 in)
    • Hard carriers: 35 x 30 x 20 cm (14.8 x 11.9 x 7.9 in)

Pets must remain in their carrier placed under the seat throughout the journey, from departure gate to arrival terminal.

Boarding with pets occurs with your assigned boarding group as shown on your boarding pass.

To help your pet during the flight:

  • Offer food and water well before the flight; avoid feeding just before departure to prevent nausea.
  • Bring a diaper if needed.
  • A familiar blanket can help calm a restless pet.

Customers traveling with pets are usually seated in the rear of the aircraft.
draft.carrierCargoDetails:
In Cargo Carrier Details

We recommend booking your journey well in advance.

  • Book your flight online at least 7 days before departure.
  • Inform Finnair about your pet within 24 hours via chat, providing carrier dimensions and total weight of pet plus carrier.
  • You will receive a payment link through the chat service.
  • Finnair aims to confirm pet bookings within 2 days; for flights to/from the USA, confirmation is aimed at least 2 weeks before departure.
  • If your pet cannot be accepted, you may get a refund of your ticket.
  • Minimum transfer time between flights with a pet in the hold is 3 hours.
  • Usually, two pets are accepted in the hold on Finnair-operated flights, one pet on Norra-operated flights; limitations may apply due to aircraft type, weather, or allergic passengers.
  • Pets cannot travel in the hold if your ticket includes flights operated by airlines other than Finnair or Norra.
  • Pets in the aircraft hold do not transfer automatically at Helsinki Airport; you must collect and re-check your pet for connecting flights.

Transportation Container Requirements

  • Container must allow pet to stand, lie down, and turn around comfortably.
  • If the carrier is too small, the pet will not be accepted at check-in.
  • Pets over 40 kg (88 lb) must be transported in a strong transportation box.
  • Finnair does not sell or rent transportation containers.
  • One container can hold:
    • Two adult pets of comparable size, or
    • Up to three puppies (under 6 months, same litter).
  • Maximum weight per pet when sharing a container is 14 kg (30 lb).
  • Some countries may restrict transporting multiple pets in one container.

Maximum Container Dimensions by Aircraft Type

Aircraft Type Max. Dimensions (cm)
A330/350 122 x 81 x 89
A319/320/321 122 x 81 x 89
E90 (Norra) 101 x 68 x 76
ATR (Norra) 81 x 57 x 53

Travel Conditions in the Hold

  • The hold is air-conditioned and heated, always above +10° Celsius.
  • No lights are present in the hold due to fire safety requirements.
  • The hold cannot be accessed during the flight.

Recommendations for Pet Comfort

  • Familiarize your pet with the container before travel.
  • Most pets relax and sleep in the dark; a familiar blanket may help.
  • Reserve water for your dog in the carrier, preferably using a sipper water bottle to avoid leaks.
  • Avoid feeding your pet just before the flight to prevent nausea.
  • IATA discourages the use of sedatives or tranquillisers during transport.

After the flight, collect your pet in the arrival hall and show the baggage receipt given at check-in to the agent.
draft.brachycephalicBreedList: Pugs, Bulldogs,   Persians, Shih Tzus, Pekingese,
draft.serviceAnimalDetails:
Service Animals (In-Cabin & Support)

Finnair allows certain assistance and service dogs with valid documentation to travel in the cabin.

  • Accepted assistance and service dogs:
    • Guide dogs and hearing dogs for visually or hearing-impaired individuals
    • Diabetic alert dogs and seizure alert dogs
    • Dogs trained to assist physically impaired people in daily life
    • Psychiatric service dogs (only on flights to/from the United States)
    • Narcotic detection dogs
    • Search and rescue dogs on official missions
  • Required documents:
    • Certificate of training
    • U.S. DOT Service Animal forms
    • Certificate of training and explanation of the mission
  • Notify Finnair at least 48 hours before departure if traveling with an assistance or service dog.
  • When submitting the special assistance form, include:
    • Dog’s breed and size (height and weight)
    • Required documents attached
    • Any additional assistance needed at the airport

Please consider the following when preparing to travel with your dog:

  • Ensure your dog has required vaccinations and certificates for departure and destination countries.
  • Complete all required certificates and forms.
  • Accustom your dog to travel and possible situations during the journey.
  • Use a vest or identifier indicating the dog is on a work assignment.
  • If assistance services are needed at the airport, arrive at least two hours before departure.

Your assistance or service dog may travel on the floor in front of your seat. When the seatbelt sign is on, the dog should be under the seat in front.

Cabin crew cannot take care of your dog's needs during the flight.

Other passengers will disembark first so you can leave at your own pace. An assistant will escort you through arrivals or to your next departure gate if connecting.

When arriving in the United Kingdom with a dog, you must remain on board until a local official inspects your dog and verifies documentation. Other countries may have similar inspection requirements upon arrival.
draft.esaDetails:
Emotional Support Animals

Emotional support animals are no longer classified as service animals under the United States Department of Transportation (DOT) regulations.

Finnair will no longer accept or accommodate the emotional support animal classification.

Emotional support animals are not accepted or accommodated by Finnair.
